structuralFindings.rationale: PepsiCo has a clear hybrid structure: central transformation function (Kanioura's ~1,000-person team) sets standards and coordinates, while two Digital Hubs (Dallas, Barcelona) serve as Centers of Excellence, and 'mission-based teams' execute cross-functional programs. Training 330,000 employees on AI indicates contextual orientation — expecting everyone to incorporate AI in their roles, not just specialists.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure: Central transformation organization under Chief Strategy & Transformation Officer (Athina Kanioura) with ~700-1,000 data engineers, software engineers, and data scientists. Two Digital Hubs (Dallas and Barcelona) serve as Centers of Excellence. 'Mission-based teams' pursue transformational programs. AI Council/Steering Committee provides governance. Internal platform 'PepGenX' built on Amazon Bedrock for experimentation. Partnership with Stanford HAI for responsible AI research.

structuralFindings.investmentSignals: 700-1,000 data/software engineers and data scientists. Two Digital Hubs creating 500+ new data/digital jobs over 3 years. Training 330,000 employees on AI. 65-70% cloud migration, targeting 95%. CapEx below 5% of net revenue. Record productivity savings targeted for 2026.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: AI reports to Chief Strategy & Transformation Officer (Kanioura), who reports directly to CEO. No dedicated CAIO — AI is bundled with strategy, M&A, data, and transformation. AI Council/Steering Committee for governance.
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: Dedicated Digital Hubs with ring-fenced headcount. Central platform (PepGenX) for experimentation. Mission-based teams get cross-functional resources. Monthly transformation benefit tracking.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Mixed: SAP rollout is multi-year foundation; agentic AI deployment is near-term (2025-2026); digital twins are medium-term (facility simulations). 100 basis points operating margin expansion over 3 years.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Hybrid — central team sets standards and prioritizes 'four or five big bets,' but mission-based teams have execution autonomy. AI Council vets AI-specific proposals.
observableMarkers.metrics: Productivity savings (record target for 2026), cloud migration %, operating margin expansion, free cash flow conversion. Joint KPIs with AWS on innovation portfolio, supply chain performance, operational productivity. Monthly benefit tracking, quarterly exec committee reporting.

summary: PepsiCo operates a Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke model (M4) with a central transformation organization of 700-1,000 engineers/data scientists under CSTO Athina Kanioura, supported by Digital Hubs in Dallas and Barcelona serving as Centers of Excellence. The company is training all 330,000 employees on AI (contextual orientation), deploying agentic AI across contact centers, workforce, and logistics, and using digital twins for manufacturing optimization. AI governance flows through an AI Council/Steering Committee, with Kanioura's team orchestrating 'mission-based teams' for major transformational programs.

conferenceFindings: CES 2026: PepsiCo announced an 'industry-first' AI and digital twin collaboration with Siemens and NVIDIA during the opening keynote. Using Siemens Digital Twin Composer built on NVIDIA Omniverse to simulate facility upgrades for Frito-Lay U.S. operations, with plans to scale globally. Laguarta emphasized embedding AI 'from farm to shelf' across the entire value chain. This represents a shift to digital-first planning using physics-based digital twins and AI agents as 'co-designers' to simulate, validate, and optimize facility layouts before physical builds.
